document_data.mainbody: '''Marlin Stormserpent''' was a noble from [[Suzail]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]]. He conspired to wield [[blueflame ghost]]s against the Crown.
document_data.Relationships: He was the son of [[Narmitra Stormserpent]] and nephew of [[Mhedarlakh Stormserpent]]; his father was long-dead. his siblings were named [[Elgrym Stormserpent]], [[Rondras Stormserpent]], and [[Nethglas Stormserpent]]. He had a pet [[stirge]] named [[Thirsty]].
document_data.Possessions: Of note, Marlin managed to seize two relics of the Nine: the ''Flying Blade'' and the ''Wyverntongue Chalice'', as well as an ''[[enchanted]]'' [[hand axe]] also made by [[the Imprisoners]], which held [[Mirt]], a moneylender. One of his amulets rendered him largely immune to the special attacks of most undead. He also bore some sort of ''[[ironguard]]''-like protection, a ''[[potion of neutralize poison]]'', and when out for trouble, a high gorget that thwarted stranglings, possibly through magic.

History.After the Council:
Marlin Stormserpent was snatched from Stormserpent Towers by Manshoon, who was at the moment controlling two [[death tyrant]]s; he overexerted himself, and was thus unable to properly relieve Marlin of the ''Flying Blade'' and ''Wyverntongue Chalice''.{{cite book/Bury Elminster Deep|122-123|13}} Marlin sought succor at Broryn Windstag's home, [[Staghaven House]]; there, he met with [[Traevyn Illance]], who was recruiting nobles to a treacherous cause.{{cite book/Bury Elminster Deep|132-135|14}} Lord Illance hatched a plot for him, where he'd set his blueflame ghosts to menace the King, [[Foril Obarskyr I]], and then pretend to save him.{{cite book/Bury Elminster Deep|141|15}} He put the plan in motion.{{cite book/Bury Elminster Deep|155-156|17}}

His ghosts were repelled, and returned to him at Stormserpent Towers. He immediately decided to flee Suzail.{{cite book/Bury Elminster Deep|188-192|20}} Taking the [[Way of the Dragon]], he headed into the [[King's Forest]], where he spent the evening; he used his blueflame ghosts there to find evenfeast. They brought him a [[bear]], unable to hunt much else.{{cite book/Bury Elminster Deep|237-239|25}} He reasoned shortly after that he would go to the Windstag family hunting lodge, have his bullyblades kill everyone there, and go there. Though they did, he was soon slain by the sorceress [[Cymmarra]], the Lady of Ghosts, at the hunting lodge. Her blueflame ghosts sliced off his arms, and then she choked him to death carelessly, despite her original intention of interrogating him about any other blueflame ghosts and the [[vampire]] [[archmage]] [[Manshoon]].

document_data.Rumors & Legends:
Unknown to Marlin, Elminster knew about his plans even before he knew of Elminster at all.{{cite book/Elminster Must Die/MMP|20-21|1}}

Rather than tell his trusted nobles of his control of blueflame ghosts, Marlin preferred to pretend he was in cahoots with at least one powerful mage, and that he had access to a lost Obarskyr potential heir. He meant to present one of the blueflame ghosts as the true Obarskyr, if it came to that.
